channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Please paint a cycle box by the traffic lights, 6th September
item.description:
Outside 2 Cirencester Road Cars often block access to our driveway causing tailbacks as they do not respect the correct white line. I believe a cycle box would solve this issue and encourage more cycling in town.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Cirencester Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Blocked drain in Alexandra Street, 6th September
item.description:
This drain (outside number 25 Alexandra St) is full of compacted vegetation which is impeding rain water from draining properly leading to overflow.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Alexandra Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bin needed, 6th September
item.description:
May I suggest a rubbish bin here, at the end of footpath. Perhaps it will encourage people not to drop their rubbish along footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finlay Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The lights are too dim in a rough area, 6th September
item.description:
The houses down brook road heading towards flats is a dodgy place to be walking day or night but the lighting needs to be bright so you are able to see down the road on who may be walking up the road, contact police for reports of what’s taken place in those flats and then you will know it’s justified
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights heading out of Cheltenham not detecting vehicles, 6th September
item.description:
The sign for ‘wait here’ is too far away from the temporary traffic light causing the lights not to change and a dangerous back up of traffic. The sign needs to be moved next to the traffic light as it is on the opposite side, currently the light heading towards Cheltenham gets priority causing dangerous overtakes and almost grid lock traffic throughout the day!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 251, London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Sunken area has been surrounded by ugly Glos Highways barriers -, 5th September
item.description:
Please confirm WHAT Glos Highways are actually doing to RESOLVE this issue which I reported 3 YEARS ago. Stop prevaricating and do something positive please. Orange barriers is NOT a proper solution Do I need to lodge an ombudsman's complaint to get action - if so, kindly let me know and I certainly will? Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Ivy Bank, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Road narrows temporary traffic sign left on the verge, 5th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18;19, Burma Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Road sign and bollard left after Priors Road resurfacing completed, 5th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Dewberry Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
